definition: Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
shore/land/continent
six (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
surname Lu
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji

sentences.english: Luji is one important writer and theorist of arts during Wei and Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 陆机是我国魏晋之际的重要作家和文学理论家。

sentences.english: From the angle of regional culture, the paper mainly discusses the relationship between Wu culture and style of LU Ji's works.
sentences.chinese: 陆机作品风格与吴地文化之间存在千丝万缕的联系。

definition: Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
Yu Xin (513-581), poet from Liang of the Southern dynasties 南朝梁朝 and author of Lament for the South 哀江南賦|哀江南赋
Zuo Si (3rd century), Jin dynasty writer and poet
Yu Shinan (558-638), politician of Sui and early Tang periods, poet and calligrapher, one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Pan Yue (247-300), later known as 潘安[Pan1 An1], famous handsome and elegant writer from the Western Jin dynasty
Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣
Zhong Yao (151-230), minister of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4] and noted calligrapher, said to have developed the regular script 楷書|楷书[kai3 shu1]
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Cao Buxing or Ts'ao Pu-hsing (active c. 210-250), famous semilegendary painter, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Cao Zhi (192-232), son of Cao Cao 曹操, noted poet and calligrapher
Wang Can (177-217), poet, generally regarded as the most brilliant of "the seven masters of Jian'an" 建安[Jian4 an1]
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
